00005 import httplib
00006 from socket import timeout
00007 from threading import Thread
00008 from time import sleep
00009 
00010 from tweepy.models import Status
00011 from tweepy.api import API
00012 from tweepy.error import TweepError
00013 
00014 from tweepy.utils import import_simplejson, urlencode_noplus
00015 json = import_simplejson()
00016 
00017 STREAM_VERSION = 1
00018 
00019 
00020 class StreamListener(object):
00021 
00022     def __init__(self, api=None):
00023         self.api = api or API()
00024 
00025     def on_data(self, data):
00026         """Called when raw data is received from connection.
00027 
00028         Override this method if you wish to manually handle
00029         the stream data. Return False to stop stream and close connection.
00030         """
00031 
00032         if 'in_reply_to_status_id' in data:
00033             status = Status.parse(self.api, json.loads(data))
00034             if self.on_status(status) is False:
00035                 return False
00036         elif 'delete' in data:
00037             delete = json.loads(data)['delete']['status']
00038             if self.on_delete(delete['id'], delete['user_id']) is False:
00039                 return False
00040         elif 'limit' in data:
00041             if self.on_limit(json.loads(data)['limit']['track']) is False:
00042                 return False
00043 
00044     def on_status(self, status):
00045         """Called when a new status arrives"""
00046         return
00047 
00048     def on_delete(self, status_id, user_id):
00049         """Called when a delete notice arrives for a status"""
00050         return
00051 
00052     def on_limit(self, track):
00053         """Called when a limitation notice arrvies"""
00054         return
00055 
00056     def on_error(self, status_code):
00057         """Called when a non-200 status code is returned"""
00058         return False
00059 
00060     def on_timeout(self):
00061         """Called when stream connection times out"""
00062         return
00063 
00064 
00065 class Stream(object):
00066 
00067     host = 'stream.twitter.com'
00068 
00069     def __init__(self, auth, listener, **options):
00070         self.auth = auth
00071         self.listener = listener
00072         self.running = False
00073         self.timeout = options.get("timeout", 300.0)
00074         self.retry_count = options.get("retry_count")
00075         self.retry_time = options.get("retry_time", 10.0)
00076         self.snooze_time = options.get("snooze_time",  5.0)
00077         self.buffer_size = options.get("buffer_size",  1500)
00078         if options.get("secure", True):
00079             self.scheme = "https"
00080         else:
00081             self.scheme = "http"
00082 
00083         self.api = API()
00084         self.headers = options.get("headers") or {}
00085         self.parameters = None
00086         self.body = None
00087 
00088     def _run(self):
00089         # Authenticate
00090         url = "%s://%s%s" % (self.scheme, self.host, self.url)
00091 
00092         # Connect and process the stream
00093         error_counter = 0
00094         conn = None
00095         exception = None
00096         while self.running:
00097             if self.retry_count is not None and error_counter > self.retry_count:
00098                 # quit if error count greater than retry count
00099                 break
00100             try:
00101                 if self.scheme == "http":
00102                     conn = httplib.HTTPConnection(self.host)
00103                 else:
00104                     conn = httplib.HTTPSConnection(self.host)
00105                 self.auth.apply_auth(url, 'POST', self.headers, self.parameters)
00106                 conn.connect()
00107                 conn.sock.settimeout(self.timeout)
00108                 conn.request('POST', self.url, self.body, headers=self.headers)
00109                 resp = conn.getresponse()
00110                 if resp.status != 200:
00111                     if self.listener.on_error(resp.status) is False:
00112                         break
00113                     error_counter += 1
00114                     sleep(self.retry_time)
00115                 else:
00116                     error_counter = 0
00117                     self._read_loop(resp)
00118             except timeout:
00119                 if self.listener.on_timeout() == False:
00120                     break
00121                 if self.running is False:
00122                     break
00123                 conn.close()
00124                 sleep(self.snooze_time)
00125             except Exception, exception:
00126                 # any other exception is fatal, so kill loop
00127                 break
00128 
00129         # cleanup
00130         self.running = False
00131         if conn:
00132             conn.close()
00133 
00134         if exception:
00135             raise
00136 
00137     def _data(self, data):
00138         for d in [dt for dt in data.split('\n') if dt]:
00139             if self.listener.on_data(d) is False:
00140                 self.running = False
00141 
00142     def _read_loop(self, resp):
00143 
00144         while self.running and not resp.isclosed():
00145 
00146             # Note: keep-alive newlines might be inserted before each length value.
00147             # read until we get a digit...
00148             c = '\n'
00149             while c == '\n' and self.running and not resp.isclosed():
00150                 c = resp.read(1)
00151             delimited_string = c
00152 
00153             # read rest of delimiter length..
00154             d = ''
00155             while d != '\n' and self.running and not resp.isclosed():
00156                 d = resp.read(1)
00157                 delimited_string += d
00158 
00159             # read the next twitter status object
00160             if delimited_string.isdigit():
00161                 next_status_obj = resp.read( int(delimited_string) )
00162                 self._data(next_status_obj)
00163 
00164         if resp.isclosed():
00165             self.on_closed(resp)
00166 
00167     def _start(self, async):
00168         self.running = True
00169         if async:
00170             Thread(target=self._run).start()
00171         else:
00172             self._run()
00173 
00174     def on_closed(self, resp):
00175         """ Called when the response has been closed by Twitter """
00176         pass
00177 
00178     def userstream(self, count=None, async=False, secure=True):
00179         if self.running:
00180             raise TweepError('Stream object already connected!')
00181         self.url = '/2/user.json'
00182         self.host='userstream.twitter.com'
00183         if count:
00184             self.url += '&count=%s' % count
00185         self._start(async)
00186 
00187     def firehose(self, count=None, async=False):
00188         self.parameters = {'delimited': 'length'}
00189         if self.running:
00190             raise TweepError('Stream object already connected!')
00191         self.url = '/%i/statuses/firehose.json?delimited=length' % STREAM_VERSION
00192         if count:
00193             self.url += '&count=%s' % count
00194         self._start(async)
00195 
00196     def retweet(self, async=False):
00197         self.parameters = {'delimited': 'length'}
00198         if self.running:
00199             raise TweepError('Stream object already connected!')
00200         self.url = '/%i/statuses/retweet.json?delimited=length' % STREAM_VERSION
00201         self._start(async)
00202 
00203     def sample(self, count=None, async=False):
00204         self.parameters = {'delimited': 'length'}
00205         if self.running:
00206             raise TweepError('Stream object already connected!')
00207         self.url = '/%i/statuses/sample.json?delimited=length' % STREAM_VERSION
00208         if count:
00209             self.url += '&count=%s' % count
00210         self._start(async)
00211 
00212     def filter(self, follow=None, track=None, async=False, locations=None, count = None):
00213         self.parameters = {}
00214         self.headers['Content-type'] = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
00215         if self.running:
00216             raise TweepError('Stream object already connected!')
00217         self.url = '/%i/statuses/filter.json?delimited=length' % STREAM_VERSION
00218         if follow:
00219             self.parameters['follow'] = ','.join(map(str, follow))
00220         if track:
00221             self.parameters['track'] = ','.join(map(str, track))
00222         if locations and len(locations) > 0:
00223             assert len(locations) % 4 == 0
00224             self.parameters['locations'] = ','.join(['%.2f' % l for l in locations])
00225         if count:
00226             self.parameters['count'] = count
00227         self.body = urlencode_noplus(self.parameters)
00228         self.parameters['delimited'] = 'length'
00229         self._start(async)
00230 
00231     def disconnect(self):
00232         if self.running is False:
00233             return
00234         self.running = False
